item.title: A-MOST 2021 Call for Papers
item.description:
17th Workshop on Advances in Model Based Testing (A-MOST 2021)

April, 2021

A-MOST 2021 will be collocated with the IEEE International Conference on Software Testing, Verification and Validation (ICST 2021).

  • Proceedings: Accepted papers will be published in the IEEE Digital Library.

  • Paper format: IEEE two-column publication format.

    • Full papers: 8 pages
    • Short papers: 4 pages
    • Journal first: 2 pages

Important Dates

  • Paper submission: Jan 10, 2021
  • Notification: Jan 31, 2021
  • Camera–ready version: Feb 20, 2021

item.title: Spiking Neural P Systems Simulation and Verification
A-MOST 2020 Program
item.description:
A-MOST: Advances in Model-based Testing

24 October, 2020

A-MOST is a one-day workshop bringing together researchers and practitioners to discuss state of the art, practice and future prospects in Model Based Testing (MBT). It provides a platform to present new approaches, methods and tools to make MBT techniques (for automatic test case generation) more deployable and useful for industry than ever.

Program

A detailed program can be found here.

item.title: Fundamental results for learning deterministic extended finite state machines from queries
Spiking Neural P Systems - Matrix Representation and Formal Verification
Implementation relations and testing for cyclic systems with refusals and discrete time
A verified and optimized Stream X-Machine testing method, with application to cloud service certification
RoboSoft: software engineering for robotics
item.description:
RoboSoft: Software Engineering for Robotics

London, UK, 13-14 November, 2019

RoboSoft is a two-day event to bring together researchers representing groups working on themes relevant for Software Engineering for Robotics, developers working on the next-generation of robotic systems in various areas of application, and regulation authorities interested in safety of robotic systems. It provides a platform to establish Software Engineering for Robotics as an important discipline in Computer Science and Electronic Engineering. The objective is to establish a common understanding of the challenges that need to be faced to ensure that results are relevant to industrial practice and regulation.

Programme

A detailed programme can be found here

item.title: An Implementation Relation for Cyclic Systems with Refusals and Discrete Time
SSBSE 2019 conference tracks and important dates
item.description:
11th Symposium on Search-Based Software Engineering

Tallinn Estonia, 31 Aug - 2 Sep, 2019

SSBSE 2019 will be collocated with the 27th ACM Joint European Software Engineering Conference and Symposium on the Foundations of Software Engineering (ESEC/FSE 2019 conference).

  • Conference proceedings: accepted papers will be published in a volume of the Springer Lecture Notes in Computer Science series (LNCS).

  • Special issue for best papers: following the conference, the authors of the best manuscripts will be invited to extend their papers into full journal papers, for a Special Section of the Information and Software Technology Journal (IST).

Tracks and Important Dates

Research Paper Track

  • Abstract submission: March 22, 2019
  • Full paper submission: March 29, 2019
  • Initial decisions and notification: May 3, 2019
  • Revised paper submission: May 17, 2019
  • Final decisions and notification: May 31, 2019
  • Camera–ready submission: June 15, 2019

Journal First Track

  • Submission: May 1, 2019
  • Notification: June 1, 2019

Short & Student Track

  • Abstract submission: May 10, 2019
  • Paper submission: May 17, 2019
  • Author notification: June 14, 2019
  • Camera ready submission: June 21, 2019

Challenge Track

The SSBSE Challenge Track is an exciting opportunity for SBSE researchers to apply tools, techniques, and algorithms on real-world software. The entrants of the SSBSE Challenge Track will compete for cash prizes totaling 1000€.

  • Submission: June 1, 2019
  • Notification: June 16, 2019
  • Camera ready: June 21, 2019
